description: The saw toothed azara (Azara serrata) is a truly amazing plant species native to South America. This hardy evergreen shrub offers year-round interest and beauty to the landscape. Its distinctive saw-toothed leaves are finely toothed and deep green in colour, adding texture and dimension to any garden. In spring, the shrub is covered in attractive white flowers with yellow centres, which are a nectar source for pollinators, such as butterflies and bees. It can thrive in many types of soils, in both full sun and partial shade, and is drought tolerant once established. The saw toothed azara is a beautiful addition to any garden and an essential component of the native landscape.
